page.syntax: HTML_Option_Code as C = a5_HTML_List_Populate(C list [,* selectedItems [,N tab_prefixes[,C format [,L html_encode [,* options[,C separator ]]]]]])

argument.name: HTML_Option_Code
argument.description: Formatted HTML code ready to be inserted into a HTML list box control.

argument.name: list
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of choices of the form " Bound_Value | Display_Value " or " Display_Value " to appear in the HTML list box control.

argument.name: selectedItems
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL. The selected (default) value for the HTML list box control.

argument.name: tab_prefixes
argument.description: Optional. Default = 0. The number of tabs to place before each line of OPTION code.

argument.name: format
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Stored|Displayed". Any other value is equivalent to "Displayed|Stored". Indicates the order of values in List.

argument.name: html_encode
argument.description:
Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = Uses *HTML_ESCAPE()to encode the values.
.F. = Does not HTML encode the values.

page.description: Creates the <option> ....</option> syntax from a crlf delimited list for use in an HTML list or combo box
page.discussion: The A5_HTML_LIST_POPULATE() function generates value code for insertion into an HTML list box control.
page.example:
dim str as C str = <<%a% a b c d e %a% ? a5_html_list_populate(str,"c",2) =a b c d e list = "a,b,c,d,e,f" list = stritran(list,",",crlf() ) ?a5_html_list_populate(list,"b",4) =a
b
c
d
e
f list = <<%a% #r|red #g|green #b|blue #c|cyan #%a% ? a5_html_list_populate(list, "r") = red green blue cyan
